page.title: 07 AN OLD BUCKLEY CUSTOM
page.content: The Buckley Jubilee was started in 1856 by three men:Edward Davies, Joseph Griffiths, and Richard Roberts. In 1956 a shield was brought to celebrate the 100th birthday.The Buckley Jubilee is, by tradition,held on the second Tuesday of July. Nowadays fifteen churches take part. 1985 was the 129th anniversary of the festival. The Buckley Jubilee is a procession in which Churches and Sunday Schools take part and march through Buckley.It is held to demonstrate our faith in God. Before the procession a service is held on the common.A different minister leads it every year.Each Sunday School or Church carries a banner bearing its name.Many people from all over the world come 'home' for the Jubilee.
